summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to T-Mobile USA, Inc., requesting telephone records for the period 2002-2006 as part of a criminal investigation into violations of federal sex trafficking and related statutes. It includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena and signed the accompanying letter requesting T-Mobile's cooperation and non-disclosure of the subpoena.

persons.name: Geoff E. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena commanding T-Mobile to appear and produce records.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for T-Mobile
events.description: T-Mobile USA, Inc. is commanded to appear before the Grand Jury for the Southern District of New York to testify and produce records.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a grand jury subpoena to T-Mobile for telephone records from 2002-2006.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, New York, New York
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felony violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), and 2422(b) (coercion and enticement).
The investigation is being conducted by a federal grand jury in the Southern District of New York, indicating a serious federal probe.
The subpoena requests all records for specific telephone numbers for the time period January 1, 2002, through December 31, 2006, suggesting the investigation focuses on activities during those years.
The government explicitly requests T-Mobile to refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The document is dated June 10, 2019, showing active investigative steps were being taken by federal prosecutors at that time.
